University of Sheffield, 1994-1999, led by Norman Blake: Michael Pidd and Estelle Stubbs, with Linda Cross, Claire Thomson, Orietta Da Rold and Simon Horobin. In partnership with the Canterbury Tales Project, at that time led by Norman Blake in partnership with Peter Robinson and Elizabeth Solopova (up to 1998), and using images and other resources supplied by the Project, the Sheffield team transcribed eight manuscripts in full (Ad3, Corpus, Dd, Gg, Ellesmere, Ha4, Hengwrt, Lansdowne), sections of some seven other manuscripts, and all manuscripts of the Franklin's Tale. No part of these transcripts is contained in this iteration of the Project.

div.l: (base) ⁊ bigynneth the Secund Nonnes Tale of Seynt Cecile with oute a ꝒProloge
(base) The Ministre and the norice vnto vices
(base) Which that men clepeth in englissh ydelnesse
(base) That porter at the gate is of delices
(base) To eschuen and by hir contrarie hire oppresse
(base) That is to seyn by leueful bisynesse
(base) Wel oghte we to doon al oure entente
(base) Lest that the feend thurgh ydelnesse vs hente
(base) For he that with his thousand cordes slye
(base) Continuelly vs wayteth to biclappe
(base) Whan he may man in ydelnesse espye
(base) He kan so lightly cacche hym in his trappe
(base) Til that a man be hent right by the lappe
(base) He nys nat war the feend hath hym in honde
(base) Wel oghte vs werche and ydelnesse withstonde
(base) And thogh men dradden neuere for to dye
(base) Yet seen men wel by reson doutelees
(base) That ydelnesse is roten slogardye
(base) Of which ther neuere comth no good nencrees
(base) And seen that slouthe hir holdeth in a lees
(base) Oonly for to slepe and ete and drynken
(base) And to deuouren al that othere swynken
div.note: Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
div.l: (base) And for to putte vs from swich ydelnesse
(base) That cause is of so greet confusioun
(base) I haue here doon my feithful bisynesse
(base) After the legende in translacioun
(base) Right of thy glorious lyf and passioun
(base) Thow with thy gerland wroght of rose and lilie
(base) Thee mene I mayde and martir Seinte Cecilie
(base) And thow that flour of virgines art alle
(base) Of whom that Bernard list so wel to write
(base) To thee at my bigynnyng I first calle
(base) Thow confort of vs wrecches do mendite
(base) Thy maydens deeth that wan thurgh hir merite
(base) The eternal lyf and of the feend victorie
(base) As man may after reden in hir Storie
(base) Thow mayde and moder doghter of thy sone
(base) Thow welle of mercy synful soules cure
(base) In whom that god for bountee chees to wone
(base) Thow humble and heigh ouer euery creature
(base) Thow nobledest so ferforth oure nature
(base) That no desdaign the makere hadde of kynde
(base) His sone in blood and flessh to clothe and wynde
div.note: Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
div.l: (base) With Inne the Cloistre blisful of thy sydis
(base) Took mannes shap the eternal loue and pees
(base) That of the tryne compas lord and gyde is
(base) Whom erthe and see and heuene out of relees
(base) Ay heryen and thow virgyne wemmelees
(base) Bar of thy body and dweltest mayde pure
(base) The creatour of euery creature
(base) Assembled is in thee Magnificence
(base) With mercy goodnesse and swich pitee
(base) That thow that art the sonne of excellence
(base) Nat oonly helpest hem that prayen thee
(base) But ofte tyme of thy benygnytee
(base) Ful frely er that men thyn help biseche
(base) Thow goost biforn and art hir lyues leche
(base) Now help thow meke and blisful faire mayde
(base) Me flemed wrecche in this desert of galle
(base) Thynk on the womman Cananee that sayde
(base) That whelpes eten somme of the crommes alle
(base) That from hir lordes table been yfalle
(base) And thogh that I vnworthy sone of Eue
(base) Be synful yet accepte my bileue
div.note: Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
div.l: (base) And for that feith is deed withouten werkis
(base) So for to werken yif me wit and space
(base) That I be quyt from thennes that moost derk is
(base) O thow that art so fair and ful of grace
(base) Be myn Aduocate in that heighe place
(base) Ther as withouten ende is songe Osanne
(base) Thow cristes moder doghter deere of Anne
(base) And of thy light my soule in prison lighte
(base) That troubled is by the contagioun
(base) Of my body and also by the wighte
(base) Of erthely lust and fals affeccioun
(base) O hauene o refut o sauacioun
(base) Of hem that been in sorwe and in distresse
(base) Now help for to my werk I wol me dresse
(base) Yet praye ich yow that reden that I write
(base) Foryeue me that I do no diligence
(base) This ilke storie subtilly to endite
(base) For bothe haue I the wordes and sentence
(base) Of hym that at the Seintes reuerence
(base) The storie wroot and folwen hir legende
(base) And pray yow that ye wol my werk amende
(base) As ferforth as god wyl me grace sende
div.note: Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
div.l: (base) First wolde I yow the name of Seinte Cecilie
(base) Expowne as men may in hir storie se
(base) It is to seyn on englissh heuenes lilie
(base) For pure chastnesse of virginitee
(base) Or for she whitnesse hadde of honestee
(base) And grene of conscience and of good fame
(base) The swote sauour lilie was hir name
(base) Or Cecile is to seyn the wey to blynde
(base) For she ensample was by good techynge
(base) Or ellis Cecile as I writen fynde
(base) Is ioyned by a manere conioignynge
(base) Of heuene and lia and here in figurynge
(base) The heuene is set for thoght of holynesse
(base) And lia for hir lastynge bisynesse
(base) Cecile may eek be seyd in this manere
(base) Wantynge of blyndnesse for hir grete light
(base) Of sapience and for hir thewes clere
(base) Or ellis lo this maydenes name bright
(base) Of heuene and leos comth for which by right
(base) Men myghte hire wel the heuene of peple calle
(base) Ensample of goode and wise werkes alle
div.note: Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
div.l: (base) For leos peple in englissh is to seye
(base) And right as men may in the heuene see
(base) The sonne and moone and sterres euery weye
(base) Right so men goostly in this mayden free
(base) Sayen of feith the magnanymytee
(base) And eek the cleernesse hool of Sapience
(base) And sondry werkes brighte of excellence
(base) And right so as thise Philosophres write
(base) That heuene is swift and round and eek brennynge
(base) Right so was faire Cecile the white
(base) Ful swift and bisy euere in good werkynge
(base) And round and hool in good perseuerynge
(base) And brennyng euere in charite ful brighte
(base) Now haue I yow declared what she highte
(base) Here endith the Second Nonnys prolog
(base) And here begynneth the tale
(base) This mayde bright Cecilie as hir lyf seith
(base) Was come of Romayns and of noble kynde
(base) And from hir Cradel vp fostred in the feith
(base) Of crist and baar his gospel in hir mynde
(base) She neuere cessed as I writen fynde
(base) Of hir prayere and god to loue and drede
(base) Bisekyng hym to kepe hir maydenhede
div.note: Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
div.l: (base) And whan this mayden sholde vn til a man
(base) Ywedded be that was ful yong of age
(base) Which that ycleped was Valerian
(base) And day was comen of hir mariage
(base) She ful deuout and humble in hir corage
(base) Vnder hir robe of gold that sat ful faire
(base) Hadde next hir flessh yclad hire in an haire
(base) And whil that the Organs maden melodie
(base) To god allone in hir herte thus soong she
(base) O lord my soule and eek my body gye
(base) Vnwemmed lest that I confounded be
(base) And for his loue that deyde vpon the tree
(base) Euery seconde and thridde day she faste
(base) Ay biddyng in hir orisons ful faste
(base) The nyght cam and to bedde moste she gon
(base) With hire housbonde as ofte is the manere
(base) And priuely to hym she seyde anon
(base) O swete and wel biloued spouse deere
(base) Ther is a conseil and ye wolde it heere
(base) Which that right fayn I wolde vnto yow seye
(base) So that ye swere ye shul it nat biwreye
div.note: Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
div.l: (base) Valerian gan faste vnto hir swere
(base) That for no cas ne thyng that myghte be
(base) He sholde neuere mo biwreyen here
(base) And thanne at erst to hym seyde she
(base) I haue an Aungel which that loueth me
(base) That with gret loue wher so I wake or slepe
(base) Is redy ay my body for to kepe
(base) And if that he may feelen out of drede
(base) That ye me touche or loue in vileynye
(base) He right anon wol sleen yow with the dede
(base) And in youre youthe thus ye shullen dye
(base) And if that ye in clene loue me gye
(base) He wol yow loue as me for youre clennesse
(base) And shewe to yow his ioye and his brightnesse
(base) This Valerian corrected as god wolde
(base) Answerde agayn if I shal trusten thee
(base) Lat me that Aungel seen and hym biholde
(base) And if that it a verray Aungel be
(base) Thanne wol I doon as thow hast prayed me
(base) And if thow loue another man for sothe
(base) Right with this swerd than wol I sle yow bothe
div.note: Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
div.l: (base) Cecile answerde right in this wise
(base) If that yow list the Aungel shal ye se
(base) So that ye trowe on crist and yow baptise
(base) Goth forth to Via Apia quod she
(base) That fro this town ne stant but Milys thre
(base) And to the poure folkes that ther dwellen
(base) Sey hem right thus as that I shal yow tellen
(base) Telle hem that I Cecile yow to hem sente
(base) To shewen yow the goode Vrban the olde
(base) For secree nedes and for good entente
(base) And whan that ye Seint Vrban han biholde
(base) Telle hym the wordes whiche I to yow tolde
(base) And whan that he hath purged yow fro synne
(base) Thanne shal ye seen that Aungel er we twynne
(base) This Valerian is to the place gon
(base) And right as hym was taught by his lernynge
(base) He foond this holy olde Vrban anon
(base) Among the Seintes buryels lotynge
(base) And he anon withouten tariynge
(base) Dide his message and whan that he it tolde
(base) Vrban for ioye hise handes gan vp holde
div.note: Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
div.l: (base) The teerys from hise eyen leet he falle
(base) Almyghty lord o Ihu crist quod he
(base) Sowere of chaast conseil hierde of vs alle
(base) The fruyt of thilke seed of chastitee
(base) That thow hast sowe in Cecilie taak to thee
(base) Lo lyk a bisy bee withouten gyle
(base) Thee serueth ay thyn owene thral Cecile
(base) For thilke spouse that she tok but now
(base) Ful lyk a fiers leoun she sendeth heere
(base) As meke as euere was any lamb to yow
(base) And with that word anon ther gan appeere
(base) An old man clad in white clothes cleere
(base) That hadde a book with lettre of gold in honde
(base) And gan biforn Valerian to stonde
(base) Valerian as deed fil doun for drede
(base) Whan he hym say and he vp hente hym tho
(base) Whan he this old man sawe standing so
(base) And on his book right thus he gan to rede
(base) Whiche forthwith anone he herd hym rede
(base) O lord o feith o god withoute mo
(base) O cristendom and fader of all also
(base) Abouen alle and oueral euery where
(base) Thise wordes al with gold ywriten were
div.note: Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
div.l: (base) Whan this was rad thanne seyde this olde man
(base) Leuestow this thyng or no sey ye or nay
(base) I leue al this thyng quod Valerian
(base) I leeue all þis þing þan þis I dar wel say
(base) For sother thyng than this I dar wel say
(base) Vnder the heuene no wight thynke may
(base) Tho vanysshed this olde man he nyste where
(base) And pope Vrban hym cristned right there
(base) Valerian goth hom and fynt Cecilie
(base) In with his chambre with an Aungel stonde
(base) This Aungel hadde of Roses and of lilie
(base) Corones two the whiche he bar in honde
(base) And first to Cecile as I vnderstonde
(base) He yaf that oon and after gan he take
(base) That oother to Valerian hir make
(base) With body clene and with vnwemmed thoght
(base) Kepeth ay wel thise corones quod he
(base) Fro Paradys to yow haue I hem broght
(base) Ne neuere mo ne shal they roten be
(base) Ne lese hir swote sauour trusteth me
(base) Ne neuere wight shal seen hem with his eye
(base) But he be chaast and hate vileynye
div.note: Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
div.l: (base) And thow Valerian for thow so soone
(base) Assentedest to good conseil also
(base) Sey what thee list and thow shalt han thy boone
(base) I haue a brother quod Valerian tho
(base) That in this world I loue no man so
(base) I pray yow that my brother may han grace
(base) To knowe the trouthe as I do in this place
(base) The Aungel seyde god liketh thy requeste
(base) And bothe with the palm of martirdom
(base) Ye shullen come vnto his blisful feste
(base) And with that word Tiburce his brother coom
(base) And whan that he the sauour vndernoom
(base) Which that the Roses and the lilies caste
(base) With Inne his herte he gan to wondre faste
(base) He spak vnto his brother in gret haste
(base) And seyde I wondre this tyme of the yere
(base) Whennes that swote sauour cometh so
(base) Of Rose and lilies that I smelle heere
(base) For thogh I hadde hem in myne handes two
(base) The sauour myghte in me no depper go
(base) The swete smel that in myn herte I fynde
(base) Hath chaunged me al in another kynde
div.note: Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
div.l: (base) Valerian seyde two corones han we
(base) Snow white and Rose reed that shynen clere
(base) Which that thyne eyen han no myght to se
(base) And as thow smellest hem thurgh my prayere
(base) So shaltow seen hem leue brother deere
(base) If it so be thow wolt withouten slouthe
(base) Bileue aright and knowen verray trouthe
(base) Tiburce answerde seystow this to me
(base) In soothnesse or in dreem I herkne this
(base) In dremes quod Valerian han we be
(base) Vnto this tyme brother myn ywys
(base) And now at erst in trouthe oure dwellyng is
(base) How wostow this quod Tiburce in what wyse
(base) Quod Valerian that shal I thee deuyse
(base) Telle me anon here with gode auyse
(base) The Aungel of god hath me the trouthe ytaught
(base) Which thow shalt seen if that thow wolt reneye
(base) The ydoles and be clene and ellis nAught
(base) And of the myracle of thise corones tweye
(base) Seint Ambrose in his preface list to seye
(base) Solempnely this noble doctour deere
(base) Commendeth it and seith in this manere
div.note: Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
div.l: (base) The palme of martirdom for to receyue
(base) Seinte Cecile fulfild of goddes yifte
(base) The world and eek hir chambre gan she weyue
(base) Witnesse Tiburces and Cecilies shrifte
(base) To whiche god of his bountee wolde shifte
(base) Corones two of floures wel smellynge
(base) And made his Aungel hem the corones brynge
(base) The mayde hath broght men to blisse aboue
(base) The world hath wist what it is worth certeyn
(base) Deuocion of chastitee to loue
(base) Tho shewed hym Cecile al open and pleyn
(base) That alle ydoles nys but a thyng in veyn
(base) For they been dowmbe and ther to they been deue
(base) And charged hym hise ydoles for to leue
(base) Who so that troweth nat this a beest he is
(base) Quod tho Tiburce if that I shal nat lye
(base) And she gan kisse his brest that herde this
(base) And was ful glad he koude trouthe espye
(base) This day I take thee for myn allye
(base) Seyde this blisful faire mayde deere
(base) And after that she seyde as ye may heere
div.note: Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
div.l: (base) Lo right so as the loue of Crist quod she
(base) Made me thy brotheres wyf right in that wise
(base) Anon for myn allie heere take I thee
(base) Syn that thow wolt thyne ydoles despise
(base) Go with thy brother now and thee baptise
(base) And make thee clene so that thow mowe biholde
(base) The Aungeles face of which thy brother tolde
(base) Tiburce answerde and seyde brother deere
(base) First tel me whider that I shal and to what man
(base) To whom quod he com forth with right good cheere
(base) I wol thee lede vnto the pope Vrban
(base) Til Vrban brother myn Valerian
(base) Quod tho Tiburce woltow me thider lede
(base) Me thynketh that it were a wonder dede
(base) Ne menestow nat Vrban quod he tho
(base) That is so ofte dampned to be deed
(base) And woneth in halkes alwey to and fro
(base) And dar nat ones putte forth his heed
(base) Men sholde hym brennen in a fyr so reed
(base) If he were founde or that men myghte hym spye
(base) And we also to bere hym compaignye
div.note: Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
div.l: (base) And whil we seken thilke diuinytee
(base) That is yhyd in heuene priuely
(base) Algate ybrend in this world shul we be
(base) To whom Cecile answerde boldely
(base) Men myghten dreden wel and skilfully
(base) This lyf to lese myn owene deere brother
(base) If thys were lyuyng oonly and noon oother
(base) But ther is bettre lyf in oother place
(base) That neuere shal be lost ne drede thee noght
(base) Which goddes sone vs tolde thurgh his grace
(base) That fadres sone hath alle thynges wroght
(base) And al that wroght is with a skilful thoght
(base) The goost that fro the fader gan procede
(base) Hath souled hem withouten any drede
(base) By word and by myracle he goddes sone
(base) Whan he was in this world declared heere
(base) That ther was oother lyf ther men may wone
(base) To whom answerde Tiburce o suster deere
(base) Ne seydestow right now in this manere
(base) Ther nys but o god lord in sothfastnesse
(base) And now of thre how maystow bere witnesse
div.note: Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
div.l: (base) That shal I telle quod she er I go
(base) Right as a man hath Sapiences thre
(base) Memorie engyn and intellect also
(base) So in o beynge of diuinytee
(base) Thre persones may ther right wel be
(base) Tho gan she hym ful bisily to preche
(base) Of cristes come and of his peynes teche
(base) And manye pointes of his passioun
(base) How goddes sone in this world was withholde
(base) To doon mankynde pleyn remyssioun
(base) That was ybounde in synne and cares colde
(base) Al this thyng she vnto Tiburce tolde
(base) And after this Tiburce in good entente
(base) With Valerian to Pope Vrban he wente
(base) That thanked god and with glad herte and light
(base) He cristned hym and made hym in that place
(base) Parfit in his lernyng goddes knyght
(base) And after this Tiburce gat swich grace
(base) That euery day he say in tyme and space
(base) The Aungel of god and euery maner boone
(base) That he god axed it was sped ful soone
div.note: Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
div.l: (base) It were ful hard by ordre for to seyn
(base) How many wondres Ihesus for hem wroghte
(base) But at the laste to tellen short and pleyn
(base) The sergeantz of the town of Rome hem soghte
(base) And hem biforn Almache the Prefect broghte
(base) Which hem opposed and knew al hir entente
(base) And to the ymage of Iubiter hem sente
(base) And seyde who so wol nat sacrifise
(base) Swap of his heed this is my sentence heer
(base) Anon thise martirs that I yow deuyse
(base) Oon Maximus that was an Officer
(base) Of the Prefectes and his Corniculer
(base) Hem hente and whan he forth the Seintes ladde
(base) Hymself he weep for pitee that he hadde
(base) Whan Maximus hadde herd the Seintes loore
(base) He gat hym of the tormentours leue
(base) And ladde hem to his hous withoute moore
(base) And with hir prechyng er that it were eue
(base) They gonnen fro the tormentours to reue
(base) And fro Maxime and fro his folk echone
(base) The false feith to trowe in god allone
div.note: Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.
div.l: (base) Cecile cam whan it was woxen nyght
(base) With preestes that hem cristned alle yfeere
